meanings.definition: Illuviates: to wash or leach out soluble constituents from soil
meanings.sent1: Heavy rain illuviates the nutrients into the deeper layers of the soil.
meanings.sent2: Farmers use irrigation to illuviates the minerals into the ground.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel illuviates the seeds all over the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness illuviates through her actions, touching everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The river illuviates the sediment downstream, creating fertile land.

meanings.definition: Illuviates: material that has been leached out of soil
meanings.sent1: The illuviates from the topsoil provide essential nutrients to the plants.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the illuviates to understand the soil composition better.
meanings.sent3: The gardener collected the illuviates to use in the compost pile.
meanings.sent4: The illuviates in the jar reminded her of the earth's natural processes.
meanings.sent5: The farmer examined the illuviates closely, looking for signs of erosion.
